meanings.definition: The position or authority of a master.
meanings.sent1: In the dojo, his mastership was unquestioned by all.
meanings.sent2: She achieved mastership over the art of calligraphy after years of practice.
meanings.sent3: His cat claimed mastership of the house, ruling over all with a paw of iron.
meanings.sent4: The mastership of the chessboard belonged to the grandmaster, his every move a stroke of genius.
meanings.sent5: The mastership of the ship was evident in the captain's confident command.

meanings.definition: The skill or proficiency of a master.
meanings.sent1: Her mastership in baking produced the most delicious cakes in town.
meanings.sent2: The artist's mastership of color and form was evident in every brushstroke.
meanings.sent3: His mastership in fixing things often led to more broken items than before.
meanings.sent4: The mastership of the pianist filled the concert hall with beautiful melodies.
meanings.sent5: The mastership of the chef shone through in the exquisite flavors of the dish.

meanings.definition: The state of being a master.
meanings.sent1: After years of training, he finally achieved mastership in martial arts.
meanings.sent2: The mastership of the craftsman was evident in the intricate details of his work.
meanings.sent3: The cat believed it had achieved mastership of the house, much to the amusement of the family.
meanings.sent4: Her mastership of negotiation allowed her to always get the best deals.
meanings.sent5: The mastership of the magician left the audience in awe of his tricks.
